sentences.english: Each year, a different sister turned fifteen.
sentences.chinese: 每年都有一个姊姊满十五岁。

sentences.english: My sister loves lollipops with teddy bear design.
sentences.chinese: 姊姊喜欢吃画有小熊图案的棒棒糖。

sentences.english: The two sisters and the stepmother were mean to Cinderella.
sentences.chinese: 灰姑娘在他的后母和姊姊眼中是很低劣的。

sentences.english: She then told me about a weight-loss clinic her sister had tried and had success with.
sentences.chinese: 然后她告诉我她姊姊之前试过一家减肥诊所超有效的。

sentences.english: My sister spends much money buying clothes.
The two ugly stepsisters try on the shoe, but their feet are too big.
sentences.chinese: 两个丑姊姊试穿这只鞋，不过她们的脚太大了。

sentences.english: The mother-in-law takes care of the door to greet guests before sending elder sister and I to different clan dose.
sentences.chinese: 婆婆派我和姊姊到不同的部落格前顾门招呼客人。

sentences.english: I met your sister last night.
My two sisters are both alumnae of George Washington High school.
sentences.chinese: 我两个姊姊都是乔治华盛顿高级中学的毕业生。

sentences.english: Her sisters tripped over her legs when they stumbled out of the bathroom.
sentences.chinese: 姊姊们从浴室里跌跌撞撞地跑出来，总被她的腿绊倒。

sentences.english: And his sister stood afar off， to wit what would be done to him.
sentences.chinese: 孩子的姊姊远远站着，要知道他究竟怎吗样。

sentences.english: I prithee , sister Kate, untie my hands.
sentences.chinese: 凯德好姊姊，请你松开我的手吧。
她两个姊姊却有漂亮衣服。

sentences.english: The wall was painted by my sister.
His sister plays computer game(s) everyday.
sentences.chinese: 他的姊姊每天玩电脑游戏。

definition: older brother's wife/sister-in-law/(polite address to a younger married woman) sister
wife of father's elder brother/aunt/(polite form of address for a woman who is about the age of one's mother)/CL:個|个[ge4]
adoptive mother (traditional adoption, i.e. without legal ramifications)
my husband and master (archaic)/playboy of rich family/pimp
mother's sister's husband/husband of mother's sister
uncle (affectionate name for a friend older than one's father)/old friend
